conversation.content: [bored] Another Tuesday, another fifty meters to read. [sigh] I swear these routes get longer every— [curious] wait, what's that buzzing? [pause] That's not normal. [slowly] Okay, so the meter's behind this panel here, but there's this weird humming and— [gasp] Oh my God. [anxious] That wire is completely exposed. The insulation's just, it's melted right off. [very quickly] And it's touching the metal siding, that's— that's really bad. [pause] [shaky voice] Someone could die. A kid could touch this. [frustrated] How long has this been like this? [anxious] I need to call this in right now. [quickly] Where's my— where's my phone? [mumbling] Come on, come on. [clearing throat] Hi, yeah, this is route seventeen, I've got a Code Red electrical hazard at 4782 Maple. [stern] No, I'm serious, completely exposed high voltage line. [passionately] You need to get someone here NOW. The whole side of the building is probably energized. [relieved] Yes, I'll stay here and keep people away until— [gasp softly] wait, there's a woman walking her dog right toward it. [shouting] Ma'am! MA'AM! Stay back from the building! [exhausted] Please, just trust me, don't touch anything metal. [warm] The repair crew's on the way. [sigh] This job, I swear.
